body:
I found out that if I define the constant `PHPUNIT_TESTSUITE` before I launch the test, the output buffer consuming while loop breaks atomatically. While this is fine for my implementation and fixes my problems, I do not know what exactly happens if I do it like that. What does the constant mean?

``` php
define('PHPUNIT_TESTSUITE', 1);
```
`PHPUNIT_TESTSUITE` is used by PHPUnit's own test suite to tell PHPUnit not to filters its sourcecode files from stacktraces.
So we can utilize this constant for our own needs as mentioned above without breaking the "rules"?
No, that constant is for PHPUnit's own test suite only.

issue.title: Don't mark closing all output buffers as risky
issue.body:
I propose `PHPUnit_Framework_RiskyTestError` only be thrown if `ob_get_level() > $this->outputBufferingLevel` (or allow some other mechanism to allow this).

I do agree that a test that does not close its _own_ output buffers should be considered risky, but code that empties all output buffers seems pretty reasonable to me.

E.g. 1: A framework wants to collect output to build a formal Response object.
E.g. 2: `TestCase::stopOutputBuffering()` empties all buffers, why is it just OK for PHPUnit to do it? ;)

If you're amenable to the idea I can send a PR.

issue.title: Output is buffered until end of execution running phpunit with symfony 1.4.x
issue.body:
| Q                   | A
| --------------------| ---------------
| PHPUnit version     | 5.7.20
| PHP version         | 5.6.31
| Installation Method | FreeBSD-Port

Hi,

when running phpunit with symfony 1.4.x output is buffered until the end of execution. I examined the sourcecode of phpunit and the new version is using output buffering and I think there is a conflict with with the output buffering from symfony.
